result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Scott J Harris was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

Defendant Scott J Harris in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State relates agreement to resolve case.  Court ordered NGI evaluation completed by Dr. Hienz  Both parties stipulating to findings of Dr. Heinz's report.
Attorney Raymond relates.
Court relates and adopts agreement recommendation.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented.  Court questions defendant.
Defendant enters No Contest Plea to Count 1.  State does not object to No Contest plea.
Felony admonitions given including firearm restrictions and voter's rights.
Court accepts No Contest plea and withholds Judgment.  Court finds Not Guilty by reason of mental disease or defect to Count 1.
Court orders Count 2 - DRI.
Court finds conditional release will not result in harm to any persons or damage to any property.  Court orders Department of Health and Human Services and the Chapter 51.42 Board of the County of defendant's residence to submit conditions of release and treatment plan.   Plan to be submitted within 21 days for Court's approval.  Court signs order.
Court orders Defendant conditional release as outpatient with Department of Health and Human Services and will reside at 229 N Mill Street #4, Barron, WI 54812.
Bond continues.
